ARABIC: إِنَّمَآ أَمْرُهُۥٓ إِذَآ أَرَادَ شَيْـًٔا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: His command when He desires a thing is just to say to it, 'Be!' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When He wills a thing He has only to say: "Be," and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Whenever He wills a thing, He just commands it “Be” and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Whenever He decides to create something He has only to say, "Exist," and it comes into existence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And His only task when He intends a thing is to command it, “Be” – and it thereupon happens!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, His command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be!" -- and it is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: His command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it: Be, so it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: His command, when He desires a thing, is to say to it 'Be,' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith unto it: Be! and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when He decrees a thing, He need only say, "Be!" and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: His affair, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith Unto it: be, and it becometh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: All His command, when He wills something, is to say to it ‘Be,’ and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily, when He intends a thing, His Command is, "be", and it is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, His Command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be!" and it is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When He wills a thing, His command is to say to it 'Be', and it is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: His command, when He wills a thing, is to say to it, “Be,” and it comes to be.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:82] His command, His affair, when He wills a thing, that is, [when He will] to create something, is just to say to it ‘Be’, and it is (a variant reading [for fa-yakūnu] has fa-yakūna, as a supplement to yaqūla, ‘to say’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But His command) regarding the resurrection, (when He intends a thing) when He wishes the resurrection to take place, (is only that he says unto it: Be! and it is) and the coming of the Hour happens.
